verses.verse: This<WG5124> is the third<WG5154> time I am coming<WG2064> to you. In the mouth<WG4750> of two<WG1417> or<WG2532> three<WG5140> witnesses<WG3144> shall every<WG3956> word<WG4487> be established.<WG2476>

I told<WG4280> you before,<WG4280> and foretell<WG4302> you, as if<WG1437> I were present,<WG3918> the second<WG1208> time; and being absent<WG548> now<WG3568> I write<WG1125> to them which heretofore<WG4258> have sinned,<WG4258> and to all<WG3956> other,<WG3062> that, if I come<WG2064> again,<WG1519> <WG3588> <WG3825> I will not spare:<WG5339>
Since<WG1893> you seek<WG2212> a proof<WG1382> of Christ<WG5547> speaking<WG2980> in me, which<WG3739> to you-ward<WG1519> <WG5209> is not weak,<WG770> but is mighty<WG1414> in you.

For though<WG1487> he was crucified<WG4717> through<WG1537> weakness,<WG769> yet<WG235> he lives<WG2198> by the power<WG1411> of God.<WG2316> For we also<WG2532> are weak<WG770> in him, but we shall live<WG2198> with him by the power<WG1411> of God<WG2316> toward<WG1519> you.

Examine<WG3985> yourselves,<WG1438> whether<WG1487> you be in the faith;<WG4102> prove<WG1381> your<WG1438> own selves.<WG1438> Know<WG1921> you not your<WG1438> own selves,<WG1438> how that Jesus<WG2424> Christ<WG5547> is in you, except<WG1509> you be reprobates?<WG96>
But I trust<WG1679> that you shall know<WG1097> that we are not reprobates.<WG96>

Now<WG1161> I pray<WG2172> to God<WG2316> that you do<WG4160> no<WG3361> <WG3367> evil;<WG2556> not that we should appear<WG5316> approved,<WG1384> but that you should do<WG4160> that which is honest,<WG2570> though we be as reprobates.<WG96>
For we can<WG1410> do nothing<WG3756> <WG5100> against<WG2596> the truth,<WG225> but for the truth.<WG225>
For we are glad,<WG5463> when<WG3752> we are weak,<WG770> and you are strong:<WG1415> and this<WG5124> also<WG2532> we wish,<WG2172> even your<WG5216> perfection.<WG2676>

Therefore<WG1223> <WG5124> I write<WG1125> these<WG5023> things being absent,<WG548> lest<WG2443> <WG3361> being present<WG3918> I should use<WG5530> sharpness,<WG664> according<WG2596> to the power<WG1849> which<WG3739> the Lord<WG2962> has given<WG1325> me to edification,<WG3619> and not to destruction.<WG2506>

Finally,<WG3063> brothers,<WG80> farewell.<WG5463> Be perfect,<WG2675> be of good comfort,<WG3870> be of one<WG3588> <WG846> mind,<WG5426> live<WG1514> in peace;<WG1518> and the God<WG2316> of love<WG26> and peace<WG1515> shall be with you.
Greet<WG782> one<WG240> another<WG240> with an holy<WG40> kiss.<WG5370>

The grace<WG5485> of the Lord<WG2962> Jesus<WG2424> Christ,<WG5547> and the love<WG26> of God,<WG2316> and the communion<WG2842> of the Holy<WG40> Ghost,<WG4151> be with you all.<WG3956> Amen.<WG281> The second epistle to the Corinthians was written from Philippi, a city of Macedonia, by Titus and Lucas.
